title: Vecna's Domain
data:
**Vecna's Domain** is a dungeon [branch](/wiki/Branch "Branch") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is made up of three levels: a forest of [dead trees](/wiki/Dead_tree "Dead tree") filled with [graveyards](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard"), a stronghold ruled by his lieutenant, and the lair of [Vecna](/wiki/Vecna "Vecna") himself, who prevents [alhoons](/wiki/Alhoon_\(EvilHack\) "Alhoon (EvilHack)") and all types of [liches](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)") from being [genocided](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") until he is defeated.

The entire branch is [non-diggable](/wiki/Non-diggable "Non-diggable"), [no-teleport](/wiki/No-teleport "No-teleport"), and [dark](/wiki/Dark "Dark").

## Generation

Vecna's Domain is accessible via a [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") that appears on the level directly below the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead").

The first level is a withered forest, filled with six graveyards - three are situated on each side of the portal. Three of the four marked staircases (chosen at random) are [giant mimics](/wiki/Giant_mimic "Giant mimic") mimicking staircases. Of the marked L, two will be standard [liches](/wiki/Lich "Lich"), and two will be [demiliches](/wiki/Demilich "Demilich"), chosen at random. Scattered around the level are six random V, eight random Z, eight random M, four random , and ten random [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap").

The second level is a stronghold surrounded by [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"), with the stairway up placed at the far east of the level; flanking it are two cells containing a [marilith](/wiki/Marilith "Marilith") each. Both mariliths are generated with an [uncursed](/wiki/Uncursed "Uncursed") [orcish bow](/wiki/Orcish_bow "Orcish bow") and 50 uncursed [orcish arrows](/wiki/Orcish_arrow "Orcish arrow"). Placed in the courtyard are six random V, four random Z, seven random M, four random  , four [revenants](/wiki/Revenant "Revenant"), and two [beholders](/wiki/Beholder_\(EvilHack\) "Beholder (EvilHack)").

The north and south ends of the central section contain two [master liches](/wiki/Master_lich "Master lich") each. Placed nearby are two random [zombies](/wiki/Zombie_\(EvilHack\) "Zombie (EvilHack)") and two random [mummies](/index.php?title=Mummy_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mummy (EvilHack) (page does not exist)"). Guarding the bridge to [Kas](/wiki/Kas "Kas")'s chamber is another marilith in a cell, generated with an uncursed orcish bow and 100 uncursed orcish arrows, and four [salamanders](/wiki/Salamander "Salamander") are placed in the lava near the [drawbridge](/wiki/Drawbridge "Drawbridge").

Kas is generated at the east end of his chamber, and stands directly on the down stairs. He is generated with [his cursed sword](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Kas "The Sword of Kas"), [plate mail](/wiki/Plate_mail "Plate mail"), a [helmet](/wiki/Helmet "Helmet"), [gauntlets](/wiki/Gauntlets_\(EvilHack\) "Gauntlets (EvilHack)"), [dwarvish boots](/wiki/Dwarvish_boots "Dwarvish boots"), and a [ring of slow digestion](/wiki/Ring_of_slow_digestion "Ring of slow digestion"). Accompanying him are a [weredemon](/wiki/Weredemon "Weredemon"), a [balrog](/wiki/Balrog "Balrog"), two demiliches, five [vampire royals](/wiki/Vampire_royal "Vampire royal") and a [vampire mage](/wiki/Vampire_mage "Vampire mage"). Adjacent to the stairs are an [iron safe](/wiki/Iron_safe "Iron safe") and a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest"), containing random loot.

The third level is Vecna's lair, and is inhabited by various liches and other powerful monsters. The stairs up are placed at the southeast corner of the map. To the northeast, there is a small room inhabited by an [alhoon](/wiki/Alhoon_\(EvilHack\) "Alhoon (EvilHack)"); this room is considered a graveyard. Four salamanders inhabit the lava river, and there is a 1⁄4 chance of a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") being placed far north of the stairs. Farther to the north, a singular master lich sits on a small island. Randomly scattered throughout the level are four random Z, four random M, two random V, two random &, two random  , twelve revenants, four liches, two demiliches, and a beholder. There is also a 7⁄20 chance of a random alhoon being created. Additionally, there are eight random objects, twelve random traps, an [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), and a [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") of every type of [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), excluding [monks](/wiki/Monk_\(player_monster\) "Monk (player monster)").

Past the lava river is Vecna's lair proper. There is a 1⁄2 chance of the secret door to the north being generated; otherwise the only way in is through the drawbridge to the east. Past the drawbridge is a [shambling horror](/wiki/Shambling_horror "Shambling horror"), two [skeletons](/wiki/Skeleton "Skeleton") and an [elder minotaur](/wiki/Elder_minotaur "Elder minotaur"). Near the middle of the building is a storeroom that contains an iron safe and two chests, all containing random loot, with a demilich stationed atop the safe. Guarding Vecna are four liches and an [arch-lich](/wiki/Arch-lich "Arch-lich"), with Vecna himself occupying a [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") directly past them. He is always generated with a cursed, rotted [robe](/wiki/Robe "Robe") of [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") and a ring of slow digestion.

Behind Vecna's throne is a [crystal chest](/wiki/Crystal_chest "Crystal chest") containing 20000 zorkmids, four uncursed [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), two uncursed [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), one blessed scroll, a single [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring") of each beatitude, an uncursed [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet"), a blessed amulet, a cursed [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), a blessed potion, three uncursed [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"), one cursed spellbook, and one blessed spellbook. This chest also has a 1⁄5 chance of containing a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker").

## Strategy

The abundance of [covetous](/wiki/Covetous "Covetous") [monster spellcasters](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") makes [boulder fort](/wiki/Boulder_fort "Boulder fort") tactics attractive to prevent being swarmed: a single lich casting [aggravate](/wiki/Aggravate "Aggravate") can easily alert many dangerous monsters to your location at once. Cursed [potions of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") can attract the various master liches, arch-liches and alhoons, but will not wake up Vecna. A [drum of earthquake](/wiki/Drum_of_earthquake "Drum of earthquake") can reach Vecna if the player is high enough level, but the [pits](/wiki/Pit "Pit") it creates can make creating a boulder fort more difficult.

Nearly every monster in Vecna's Domain is either [demonic](/wiki/Demonic "Demonic") or [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), so weapons such as [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") or [Demonbane](/wiki/Demonbane "Demonbane") work well - the [Hammer of the Gods](/wiki/Hammer_of_the_Gods "Hammer of the Gods") in particular, created by fusing Sunsword and Demonbane, will make quick work of most threats and works as a very strong ranged option. In addition to the Hammer of the Gods, spells such as [magic missile](/wiki/Spell_of_magic_missile "Spell of magic missile") are also powerful ranged options - be aware that high-level spell-casters can cast reflection, so [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray")-type attacks will not always be effective. Due to the high number of zombies present and the as well as one or more alhoons, it is prudent to [grease](/wiki/Grease "Grease") your headwear to avoid forgetting spells or [skills](/wiki/Skills "Skills").

## History

Vecna's Domain is introduced in EvilHack 0.7.0.

## Messages

- You hear a mysterious chanting.  
  You hear the tortured cries of the damned.

  There is a portal to Vecna's Domain on the level.

- You enter a desolate landscape, completely devoid of life.  
  Every fiber of your being tells you to leave this evil place, now.

  These messages are displayed upon entering the branch for the first time.

Vecna's Domain

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Vecna's Domain is a dungeon branch that appears in EvilHack. It is made up of three levels: a forest of dead trees filled with graveyards, a stronghold ruled by his lieutenant, and the lair of Vecna himself, who prevents alhoons and all types of liches from being genocided until he is defeated.

The entire branch is non-diggable, no-teleport, and dark.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
    • 1.1 First level
    • 1.2 Second level
    • 1.3 Third level
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Messages

Generation

Vecna's Domain is accessible via a magic portal that appears on the level directly below the Valley of the Dead.

First level

The first level is a withered forest, filled with six graveyards - three are situated on each side of the portal. Three of the four marked staircases (chosen at random) are giant mimics mimicking staircases. Of the marked L, two will be standard liches, and two will be demiliches, chosen at random. Scattered around the level are six random V, eight random Z, eight random M, four random  , and ten random traps.

Second level

The second level is a stronghold surrounded by lava, with the stairway up placed at the far east of the level; flanking it are two cells containing a marilith each. Both mariliths are generated with an uncursed orcish bow and 50 uncursed orcish arrows. Placed in the courtyard are six random V, four random Z, seven random M, four random  , four revenants, and two beholders.

The north and south ends of the central section contain two master liches each. Placed nearby are two random zombies and two random mummies. Guarding the bridge to Kas's chamber is another marilith in a cell, generated with an uncursed orcish bow and 100 uncursed orcish arrows, and four salamanders are placed in the lava near the drawbridge.

Kas is generated at the east end of his chamber, and stands directly on the down stairs. He is generated with his cursed sword, plate mail, a helmet, gauntlets, dwarvish boots, and a ring of slow digestion. Accompanying him are a weredemon, a balrog, two demiliches, five vampire royals and a vampire mage. Adjacent to the stairs are an iron safe and a chest, containing random loot.

The third level is Vecna's lair, and is inhabited by various liches and other powerful monsters. The stairs up are placed at the southeast corner of the map. To the northeast, there is a small room inhabited by an alhoon; this room is considered a graveyard. Four salamanders inhabit the lava river, and there is a 1⁄4 chance of a forge being placed far north of the stairs. Farther to the north, a singular master lich sits on a small island. Randomly scattered throughout the level are four random Z, four random M, two random V, two random &, two random  , twelve revenants, four liches, two demiliches, and a beholder. There is also a 7⁄20 chance of a random alhoon being created. Additionally, there are eight random objects, twelve random traps, an axe, and a corpse of every type of player monster, excluding monks.

Past the lava river is Vecna's lair proper. There is a 1⁄2 chance of the secret door to the north being generated; otherwise the only way in is through the drawbridge to the east. Past the drawbridge is a shambling horror, two skeletons and an elder minotaur. Near the middle of the building is a storeroom that contains an iron safe and two chests, all containing random loot, with a demilich stationed atop the safe. Guarding Vecna are four liches and an arch-lich, with Vecna himself occupying a throne directly past them. He is always generated with a cursed, rotted robe of drain resistance and a ring of slow digestion.

Behind Vecna's throne is a crystal chest containing 20000 zorkmids, four uncursed gems, two uncursed scrolls, one blessed scroll, a single ring of each beatitude, an uncursed amulet, a blessed amulet, a cursed potion, a blessed potion, three uncursed spellbooks, one cursed spellbook, and one blessed spellbook. This chest also has a 1⁄5 chance of containing a magic marker.

Strategy

The abundance of covetous monster spellcasters makes boulder fort tactics attractive to prevent being swarmed: a single lich casting aggravate can easily alert many dangerous monsters to your location at once. Cursed potions of invisibility can attract the various master liches, arch-liches and alhoons, but will not wake up Vecna. A drum of earthquake can reach Vecna if the player is high enough level, but the pits it creates can make creating a boulder fort more difficult.

Nearly every monster in Vecna's Domain is either demonic or undead, so weapons such as Sunsword or Demonbane work well - the Hammer of the Gods in particular, created by fusing Sunsword and Demonbane, will make quick work of most threats and works as a very strong ranged option. In addition to the Hammer of the Gods, spells such as magic missile are also powerful ranged options - be aware that high-level spell-casters can cast reflection, so ray-type attacks will not always be effective. Due to the high number of zombies present and the as well as one or more alhoons, it is prudent to grease your headwear to avoid forgetting spells or skills.

History

Vecna's Domain is introduced in EvilHack 0.7.0.

Messages

You hear a mysterious chanting.
You hear the tortured cries of the damned.
There is a portal to Vecna's Domain on the level.
You enter a desolate landscape, completely devoid of life.
Every fiber of your being tells you to leave this evil place, now.
These messages are displayed upon entering the branch for the first time.

rawPage:
'''Vecna's Domain''' is a dungeon [[branch]] that appears in [[EvilHack]]. It is made up of three levels: a forest of [[dead tree]]s filled with [[graveyard]]s, a stronghold ruled by his lieutenant, and the lair of [[Vecna]] himself, who prevents [[Alhoon (EvilHack)|alhoons]] and all types of [[Lich (monster class)|liches]] from being [[genocide]]d until he is defeated. The entire branch is [[non-diggable]], [[no-teleport]], and [[dark]]. ==Generation== Vecna's Domain is accessible via a [[magic portal]] that appears on the level directly below the [[Valley of the Dead]]. ===First level===

The first level is a withered forest, filled with six graveyards - three are situated on each side of the portal. Three of the four marked staircases (chosen at random) are [[giant mimic]]s mimicking staircases. Of the marked L, two will be standard [[lich]]es, and two will be [[demilich]]es, chosen at random. Scattered around the level are six random V, eight random Z, eight random M, four random {{mcsl| }}, and ten random [[trap]]s. ===Second level===

The second level is a stronghold surrounded by [[lava]], with the stairway up placed at the far east of the level; flanking it are two cells containing a [[marilith]] each. Both mariliths are generated with an [[uncursed]] [[orcish bow]] and 50 uncursed [[orcish arrow]]s. Placed in the courtyard are six random V, four random Z, seven random M, four random {{monsym|ghost}}, four [[revenant]]s, and two [[Beholder (EvilHack)|beholders]]. The north and south ends of the central section contain two [[master lich]]es each. Placed nearby are two random [[Zombie (EvilHack)|zombies]] and two random [[Mummy (EvilHack)|mummies]]. Guarding the bridge to [[Kas]]'s chamber is another marilith in a cell, generated with an uncursed orcish bow and 100 uncursed orcish arrows, and four [[salamander]]s are placed in the lava near the [[drawbridge]]. Kas is generated at the east end of his chamber, and stands directly on the down stairs. He is generated with [[The Sword of Kas|his cursed sword]], [[plate mail]], a [[helmet]], [[Gauntlets (EvilHack)|gauntlets]], [[dwarvish boots]], and a [[ring of slow digestion]]. Accompanying him are a [[weredemon]], a [[balrog]], two demiliches, five [[vampire royal]]s and a [[vampire mage]]. Adjacent to the stairs are an [[iron safe]] and a [[chest]], containing random loot. ===Third level===

The third level is Vecna's lair, and is inhabited by various liches and other powerful monsters. The stairs up are placed at the southeast corner of the map. To the northeast, there is a small room inhabited by an [[Alhoon (EvilHack)|alhoon]]; this room is considered a graveyard. Four salamanders inhabit the lava river, and there is a {{frac|4}} chance of a [[forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] being placed far north of the stairs. Farther to the north, a singular master lich sits on a small island. Randomly scattered throughout the level are four random Z, four random M, two random V, two random &, two random {{monsym|ghost}}, twelve revenants, four liches, two demiliches, and a beholder. There is also a {{frac|7|20}} chance of a random alhoon being created. Additionally, there are eight random objects, twelve random traps, an [[axe]], and a [[corpse]] of every type of [[player monster]], excluding [[Monk (player monster)|monks]]. Past the lava river is Vecna's lair proper. There is a {{frac|2}} chance of the secret door to the north being generated; otherwise the only way in is through the drawbridge to the east. Past the drawbridge is a [[shambling horror]], two [[skeleton]]s and an [[elder minotaur]]. Near the middle of the building is a storeroom that contains an iron safe and two chests, all containing random loot, with a demilich stationed atop the safe. Guarding Vecna are four liches and an [[arch-lich]], with Vecna himself occupying a [[throne]] directly past them. He is always generated with a cursed, rotted [[robe]] of [[drain resistance]] and a ring of slow digestion. Behind Vecna's throne is a [[crystal chest]] containing 20000 zorkmids, four uncursed [[gem]]s, two uncursed [[scroll]]s, one blessed scroll, a single [[ring]] of each beatitude, an uncursed [[amulet]], a blessed amulet, a cursed [[potion]], a blessed potion, three uncursed [[spellbook]]s, one cursed spellbook, and one blessed spellbook. This chest also has a {{frac|5}} chance of containing a [[magic marker]]. ==Strategy== The abundance of [[covetous]] [[monster spell]]casters makes [[boulder fort]] tactics attractive to prevent being swarmed: a single lich casting [[aggravate]] can easily alert many dangerous monsters to your location at once. Cursed [[potion of invisibility|potions of invisibility]] can attract the various master liches, arch-liches and alhoons, but will not wake up Vecna. A [[drum of earthquake]] can reach Vecna if the player is high enough level, but the [[pit]]s it creates can make creating a boulder fort more difficult. Nearly every monster in Vecna's Domain is either [[demonic]] or [[undead]], so weapons such as [[Sunsword]] or [[Demonbane]] work well - the [[Hammer of the Gods]] in particular, created by fusing Sunsword and Demonbane, will make quick work of most threats and works as a very strong ranged option. In addition to the Hammer of the Gods, spells such as [[Spell of magic missile|magic missile]] are also powerful ranged options - be aware that high-level spell-casters can cast reflection, so [[ray]]-type attacks will not always be effective. Due to the high number of zombies present and the as well as one or more alhoons, it is prudent to [[grease]] your headwear to avoid forgetting spells or [[skills]]. ==History== Vecna's Domain is introduced in EvilHack 0.7.0. ==Messages== {{message|You hear a mysterious chanting.
You hear the tortured cries of the damned.|There is a portal to Vecna's Domain on the level.}} {{message|You enter a desolate landscape, completely devoid of life.
Every fiber of your being tells you to leave this evil place, now.|These messages are displayed upon entering the branch for the first time.}} [[Category:EvilHack dungeon branches]]
